description: REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS &– Marketing Automation Tool  ABOUT FCC  FCC is Canada’s leading agriculture and food lender, dedicated to the industry that feeds the world. FCC employees are committed to the long-standing success of those who produce and process Canadian food by providing flexible financing, AgExpert business management software, information and knowledge. FCC provides a complement of expertise and services designed to support the complex and evolving needs of food businesses. As a financial Crown corporation, FCC is a stable partner that reinvests profits back into the industry and communities it serves. For more information, visit fcc.ca.  RFP CONTACT  Dhruv Bhatt  Procurement and Vendor Manager Farm Credit Canada procurement@fcc.ca  RFP SCOPE  FCC is looking for a Saas solution that will enable Marketing Automation whereby pushing analytics and data from website to CRM (E.g. User behavior, known users, content engagement) execute through Multi-channel Links email, social, web, etc. enhance personalization offerings with targeted campaigns and tactics Help Improve Employee Engagement and Confidence by creating personalized experiences for customers without burdening their own capacity identifying areas of opportunity from an organic and paid perspective.  RFP PARTICULARS  This Request for Proposal has been released to all bidders on MERX during the Tender Opening. Q&A review will be complete until August 1st , 2023 at 5:00 PMwhich will be answered before the RFP Closing Date, the RFP Closing Date Time tender halls                        OBJECTIVE The objective of  This Request for Proposal is to provide Marketing Automation    Renewal Tool to get business and improve the vendors’ effectiveness improvement than by preparing custom Web   Application !-descriptionAppelOffres-eng  “ and then render javascript to display reading summary och this summary also will update whichever Q&A screened  tender reject respectively. full_summary:
### Government Tender: Marketing Automation Tool
#### Solicitation Reference Number: PS23-DB-003

[Please take note of the following details regarding the Marketing Automation Tool government tender:]

*   The tender's reference number is PS23-DB-003 and is a Request for Proposal (RFP) focused on acquiring a Marketing Automation Tool.
*   The organization behind the tender is Farm Credit Canada (FCC), a government-owned corporation addressing the financial needs of Canada's agricultural and food industry.
*   The tool is expected to automate marketing processes and provide valuable insights that improve customer engagement, customer loyalty, and the overall performance of the organization.
*   The contract duration is up to 5 years.

Through this Request for Proposal, FCC is seeking a reliable and efficient marketing automation solution that will aid the organization in:

*   Automating key marketing activities through analytics and data integration
*   Improving employee engagement and confidence  
*   Building customer loyalty through personalized marketing offerings
*   Managing consent and preference
*   Harmonizing customer information
*   Surfacing key information in the organization's CRM

Bidders are expected to submit their proposals by August 10, 2023, at 2:00 PM CST, and will be evaluated based on the provided criteria. Interested parties can access the official RFP announcement and other relevant documents on the [MERX website](https://www.merx.com/).

Please note that the provided schedule dates may be subject to change; however, all notification will be communicated to bidders via amendments on MERX. 

This RFP is covered by the provisions of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

Any questions must be submitted by July 21, 2023, at 2:00 PM CST, with FCC providing responses before August 1, 2023.

All subcontractors and suppliers are required to comply with the Official Languages Act for Canada and ensure a respectful approach in interacting with communications officials from various linguistic backgrounds.

For more information about government procurement, including the bidding process, contact [Dhruv Bhatt](mailto:procurement@fcc-fac.ca).
